tax Authorities that they did lie which got them into more trouble  giving false information on the hack licence application obtaining a DC drivers licence under flase pretenses  as well as not paying the Franchise Tax  DC has been going after residents and nonresidents alike who have not paid the Franchise TaxI could set up a Corporation in Virginia or Maryland and register the vehicle to it but again the cost hassle and tax implications would make it unfeasible   If I were to do something like that I would register a limousine to my new Virginia corporation and do Uber Black  That at least would be more profitable  Virginia does not require a special licence to drive a limousine  It would not be worth the trouble to do this for UberX given the princely sums that UberX pays

certain classes of vehicles including taxicabs   Maryland does not enforce that rule except in individual cases where you get a police with a fly up his noseAs to Virginia I am more than well aware of what happened as several of the drivers there asked me to help the deal with it   First you will be aware of the County Decal business  The suburban an d exurban counties have no problem issuing a decal to vehicles carrying out of state plates  Recently Arlington and Farifax passed ordinances requiring that vehicles parked on public streets for more than a  certain period of time carry Virginia registration or in the case of nonresidents military government corporate assignment students a reciprocity sticker  As these cab drivers are residents they could not get a reciprocity sticker  They hired a lawyer and tried to go both to Richmond and the local government to get an exemption  One kept sending them back to the other neither would help them   Finally Richmond told them simply to buy the Virginia plates and pay the Uninsured Motorist Fee   As you are no doubt aware you can get Virginia plates without insurance you must pay a fee however to get them   These drivers were trying to avoid that or having to carry two policies  As taxicablimousine insurance  is a nich market in Washington none of the insurers there are admitted in Virginia  Richmond was willing to accept the DC insurance just the same but in DC the minimums are lower  Richmond did tell the drivers that if they could get their limits up to Virginia standards they would accept the nonadmitted policy  DC cab drivers can not purchase higher limits or other protections some of us want to do that but can not  Thus the drivers were frustrated again   As Arlington and Fairfax are enforcing these laws viciously the drivers had to pay up  Those who have garages have manged to duck this but even those who park in a driveway have not managed to do soAs for the commercial vehicles in the residential neighbourhoods you might recall that you have driven by townhouse developments or in some cases condominiumapartment complexes and seen a long line of DC taxicabs parked on the main road  This is because the covenants on the deeds in the townhouse developmentscondominiums or the Homeowners Association Rules have banned the parking of commercial vehicles  For the apartments the landlord will not park commercial vehicles on his lots  For many years some cab drivers used magnetic top lights against the DC rules and had magnetic panels painted in the same color as the cab  When they went home they could remove the top light and place the panels over the lettering  This allowed them to duck the Commercial Vehicle definition in the covenantsRules as those rules usually defined a commercial vehicle as something with lettering  The Hplate alone did not bring the vehicle into the definition of commercial vehicleNow that the Taxicab Commission has mandated these Let Us Get More Cab Drivers Robbed and Killed lights and required a seal on them they want to make sure that more of us get robbed or killed the driver can not remove the light   He can still buy panels to cover the lettering on the new paint job but I have yet to see a covering for the new light  I would wonder if a canvass or box over the light would violate the covenantsRules or not
